conclusion: Path D → A is carried out at the constant pressure P₁ while the volume is reduced from V₂ to V₁.
For any quasi-static process at constant pressure, W = ∫ P dV = P (V_final – V_initial).
Taking the limits V = V₂ → V₁ and P = P₁, W_D→A = P₁ (V₁ – V₂).
Since V₁ < V₂, V₁ – V₂ is negative, so the work done by the gas on the surroundings is W_D→A = –P₁ (V₂ – V₁).
In magnitude, P₁(V₂ – V₁) is done on the gas.
